intro: Gastrolychnis gonosperma, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
